com.erikartymiuk.badbudgetlogic.main

Class Account

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.erikartymiuk.badbudgetlogic.main.Account
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Source
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SavingsAccount

    public class Account
extends java.lang.Object
implements Source
    The basic account class representing cash accounts. Examples would include a checking account, cash, retirement accounts, and, a savings account although a savings account should be a member of the subclass SavingsAccount, as it allows for setting up regular contributions.

      Constructor for cash accounts (excludes savings accounts)

      • Account

        public Account(java.lang.String name,
               double value,
               boolean quicklook)
        throws BadBudgetInvalidValueException
        Constructor for cash accounts (excludes savings accounts)
        Parameters:
        name - - User description of account (non-null and not empty)
        value - - Initial value of account
        quicklook - - Should this value show up in quickLook predictions
        Throws:
        BadBudgetInvalidValueException

    • Method Detail

      • verifyValues

        public static int verifyValues(java.lang.String name)
        Verifies that the values on account creation are valid.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the account being created
        Returns:
        an error code indicating various error states 0 - Values are error free 1 - The name is null 2 - The name is empty

      • getPredictData

        public PredictDataAccount getPredictData(int index)
        Get the PredictData at row index. Each row of the predict data list should hold data for a single day. It is up to the prediction algorithm to correctly populate and retrieve items from this list.
        Parameters:
        index - - the index representing the day since the start day that we want to examine.

      • setPredictData

        public void setPredictData(int index,
                           PredictDataAccount pda)
        Sets a row in this accounts predictData list. It is up to the prediction algorithm to correctly maintain this list during the course of its run.
        Parameters:
        index - - the index of the list element to set, should correspond to a date
        pda - - the predictData to set this element to

      • addPredictData

        public void addPredictData(PredictDataAccount pda)
        Adds the specified predict data to the end of this account predict data list
        Parameters:
        pda - - the predict data to add

      • getPrediction

        public PredictDataAccount getPrediction(java.util.Date day)
        Returns the predict data row for the given day. Should first call the predict method of the prediction class with day between the start and target dates that the prediction was done with.
        Parameters:
        day - - the day to retrieve the prediction for
        Returns:
        - the predict data for the given day

      • deposit

        public void deposit(double amount)
        Deposit money (increase an accounts value).
        Parameters:
        amount - - the amount to increase the account's value

      • withdraw

        public boolean withdraw(double amount)
        Withdraw money (decrease an accounts value). Returns true if account remains positive (or 0) after withdrawal. Returns negative if account went negative after withdrawal. Withdrawal still occurs.
        Parameters:
        amount - - the amount to decrease the account's value by
        Returns:
        - indicates if this withdrawal caused the account to go negative

      • value

        public double value()

      • predictLossForDayIndex

        public void predictLossForDayIndex(java.lang.String destinationDescription,
                                   double lossAmount,
                                   boolean addBack,
                                   double addBackAmount,
                                   int dayIndex)
        Source Interface implementation method. For accounts the account value is reduced by the lossAmount on the day specified by dayIndex. This is the predict loss implementation for use with the prediction algorithm. It processes the loss for this source by updating its prediction rows appropriately. This method also handles an add back to the source.
        Specified by:
        predictLossForDayIndex in interface Source
        Parameters:
        destinationDescription - - a string description of what the funds are being used for. Used for the transaction history
        lossAmount - - the amount of funds needed
        addBack - - true if the destination is a budget item and that budget item has funds to add back to the source
        addBackAmount - - the amount to add back to the source (if applicable)
        dayIndex - - the date as an index or offset from prediction start date

      • clearPredictData

        public void clearPredictData()
        Empties this account's predict data list. (Both the vanilla and source rows)

      • update

        public void update(int dayIndex)
        After running the prediction algorithm this method updates this account's values to the value's it would have on the day represented by day index.
        Parameters:
        dayIndex - - the day, as an offset from the start date used in the prediction algorithm, to update this accounts values to.

      • updateNextDatesOnly

        public void updateNextDatesOnly(int dayIndex)
        Updates this account next dates only. Since a vanilla account has no next dates this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        dayIndex - - the day index to update to
